body:
I would love this feature as onenote links are now messing up my automated onedrive backup to my openmediavault server.

ERROR : <onenotelink  in onedrive Documents folder>: Failed to copy: failed to open source object: itemNotFound: The specified item does not exist, or does not have content.

currently I have to move the links to another folder to get rid of the errors.

Does anyone fancy fixing this?  Reading [the docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/resources/driveitem), working out how rclone can identify the onenote links?

In fact if someone just did that doc reading bit, I'd be willing to do the code!

I'd very much like this to be fixed.
I know many items end with the `.one` file extension, could this be filtered?
It might be a bit overkill, but might it be possible to find out this information through the OneNote api?

issue.title: Ignore OneNote Notebooks

repository.name: rclonesync-V2
repository.description: A Bidirectional Cloud Sync Utility using rclone

issue.body: Similar to with Google docs & https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/211 can we ignore onenote notebooks?

body:
> I'd very much like this to be fixed.
> I know many items end with the `.one` file extension, could this be filtered?
> It might be a bit overkill, but might it be possible to find out this information through the OneNote api?

@Cnly do you have any ideas here?

It is possible to distinguish OneNote files from normal files. They don't end in `.one`, though.

We can read the `package` field when getting metadata for a file. https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/docs/api-reference/v1.0/resources/package
Thank you!  My OneDrive backup on FreeNas is choking with the OneNote files

issue.title: onedrive: ignore OneNote files by default - fixes #211

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
OneNote files are a kind of files that look like files, but behave like folders. Operations like `Open` and `Update` fail on them. This PR hides them from directory listing, and prevent invalid operations on them, returning more user-friendly error messages. 

Since hiding these files from listing may also prevent them from being deleted, the flag `--onedrive-expose-onenote-files` is also added, which allows OneNote files to show up in directory listing. Illegal operations on them are still rejected even if this flag is set.

This should fix #211.

body:
Hello everyone :) I've just created a patch for this. I'd request you to help test out the code. You can find downloads [here](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.43-117-g72b7008d-onedrive-ignore-onenote-files-211-beta/) or, if you prefer, build the code yourself. You can find the description for the changes here: #2616.

Since OneNote files are special items that look like files but behave like folders, please feel free to comment if you find anything wrong.
This is now in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) and will be in 1.44
remove the drive config manually and try again, for me I got the same error - I don't believe config works across versions.

@wlmpie I think we should have fixed that problem and you should be able to migrate your config just by re-configuring the backend.

I saw you mentioned that "after running rclone config" you got that error. May I confirm whether you had just run `rclone config`, or you had run `rclone config` _and_ gone through the configuration again? If you had done the latter with the latest beta but you still got that error, please open a new issue about that. Many thanks!

Everything works!
Tried the latest beta again, but as it runs on a linux server (openmediavault) I had to do the authorization on a desktop machine. Previously I did not use the beta version on this desktop windows machine and got the wrong configuration. This time I used the latest beta on the server as well as the desktop and now everything works. And it does ignore my onenote links. 
So this bug is fixed. 
Many Thanks for that and sorry for my ignorance on using rclone config across versions.

Is this actually fixed? Using 1.44 with OneDrive Business and it chokes trying to sync all the ".one" files. I am doing this on behalf of someone else so I'll have to learn more about the file - it might be slightly different than the original issue. The error is totally different than reported here though. It says:

"Failed to copy: activityLimitReached: The application or user has been throttled"

But all other files copy/sync fine without that error. It only seems to happen when trying to replace an existing instance of it on the remote. If I manually delete it from the remote, it will copy it fine.

> Is this actually fixed? Using 1.44 with OneDrive Business and it chokes trying to sync all the ".one" files. I am doing this on behalf of someone else so I'll have to learn more about the file - it might be slightly different than the original issue. The error is totally different than reported here though. It says:
> 
> "Failed to copy: activityLimitReached: The application or user has been throttled"

That sounds more like some kind of rate limiting that an re-occurrence of this issue.  Though if it just does it on the.one files, that is odd.

If you can make a reproduction then it might be worth making a new issue
@ncw I agree that it is strange. I don't think I have the whole story here. I will monitor it for a bit and open an issue if/when I have some better supporting evidence.
